title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-Controlled Phase I/II Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Immunogenicity of Ad5-nCoV for Inhalation in Adults 18 Years of Age and Older
description_brief: This study is a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled I/II clinical trial, in order to evaluate the safety and immunogenicity of Recombinant Novel Coronavirus Vaccine (Adenovirus Type 5 Vector) for Inhalation in adults 18 years of Age and Older.
drug: Ad5-nCoV (Recombinant Novel Coronavirus Vaccine, adenovirus type 5 vector; inhalation/aerosol formulation)
Ad5-nCoV (intramuscular formulation, also marketed as Convidecia)
explanation_target: Reason: The trial tests a recombinant adenovirus type‑5 vector COVID‑19 vaccine (Ad5‑nCoV) delivered by inhalation to evaluate safety and immunogenicity — i.e., a SARS‑CoV‑2 preventive vaccine, not an Alzheimer’s disease therapy. Therefore it does not fit any of the Alzheimer’s trial categories (disease‑targeted biologic/small molecule, cognitive enhancer, or neuropsychiatric symptom improvement). citeturn0search5turn0search7

Act: Key extracted details — intervention name: Ad5‑nCoV (Recombinant Novel Coronavirus Vaccine, adenovirus type 5 vector) with inhalation/aerosol administration; trial design: randomized, double‑blind, placebo‑controlled Phase I/II (NCT04840992). The inhaled/aerosol Ad5‑nCoV has been evaluated in phase 1/2 studies and reported in the literature. citeturn0search5turn0search1turn0search7

Reflect: Classification check — the intervention is an infectious‑disease vaccine (biologic) targeting SARS‑CoV‑2, not Alzheimer’s pathology or cognitive/behavioral symptoms. According to the provided category definitions, this trial should be classified as 'N/A' because it is not an Alzheimer’s therapeutic trial. Supporting registry and publication entries are cited above. citeturn0search5turn0search7
